comment: Yesterday I retweeted a guy who was aghast after having discovered that he'd been issued an evacuation notice by his local government , in a town which had no diesel fuel . How am I supposed to get out of here ? He asked . This is the reality they're facing <URL>

comment: Even for those lucky enough to have fuel , many have no idea which roads to take or how to get out . Why ? Because they have no electricity and therefore no internet , no Google maps , no functioning GPS . You can't call an Uber to get you out of a fire zone <URL>
